title: Will learning analytical reading improve my listening skills? (Listening not to hear, but to understand, evaluate, and remember) - Quora

response.answer_text: Working on both of these kinds of skills — though they are different— will contribute to each other because they strengthen your attention muscle. Building one’s ability to be present with clear mind will result in more appropriate responses and choices and stronger connections. The quality of your attention helps to make space for creativity and understanding and facilitates learning, flexibility, and problem-solving. And others will be more likely to interact and work with you effectively when you are contributing your attention and can facilitate those actions. So, yes, it’s worth it to push your learning edges! Good luck!

It may help, however remember that the 2 are separate skills. It also depends a lot on “how” you are doing that reading. There is analysis and there is analysis! :-) Having said that, if you have poor listening skills, for whatever reason, what you are doing may help, but not necessarily. You need to work on your listening separately and if you do, your reading strategy may well help “aspects” of your listening. Listening can be used for many purposes in learning a language.
